news_header: Kobe Steel shares rose 9% after the company raised its fiscal 2024 earnings forecast despite a decline in nine-month profit.
news_original_title: Kobe Steel 9M Earnings Down; Lifts FY24 Profit View, Revises Dividend; Stock Up
news_text: Kobe Steel, Ltd. saw its shares increase by around 9% in Japan after the company raised its fiscal 2024 earnings forecast, even though its nine-month profit fell by 6.3% compared to the previous year. The company also revised its year-end dividend per share to 55 yen from 45 yen, resulting in a total dividend of 100 yen per share, up from 90 yen. For fiscal 2024, Kobe Steel expects an attributable profit of 130 billion yen, an 18.7% increase from last year, while operating profit is projected to decrease by 13% to 140 billion yen.
